summary: Email from Assistant U.S. Attorney M to attorney Gary Bloxsome, confirming that federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York are investigating conduct relating to Jeffrey Epstein and inquiring whether Bloxsome represents HRH The Duke of York (Prince Andrew). The email seeks to establish contact for discussion.

persons.name: Gary Bloxsome
persons.context: Recipient of the email from federal prosecutors; identified as potentially representing HRH The Duke of York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure whose conduct is under investigation by the U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York.

persons.name: HRH The Duke of York
persons.context: Prince Andrew, whom Gary Bloxsome may represent; subject of inquiry by federal prosecutors in relation to the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Prosecutors inquire whether Bloxsome currently represents the Duke of York, indicating a potential attorney-client relationship.
Colleagues working together as federal prosecutors on the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
Prosecutor reaching out to attorney to establish contact regarding the Epstein investigation and his client.
The Duke of York is subject of inquiry by prosecutors investigating conduct related to Epstein.

events.title: Prosecutor Contact Regarding Epstein Investigation
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney M emails attorney Gary Bloxsome to confirm representation of HRH The Duke of York and discuss the ongoing Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors from the U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, are actively investigating conduct relating to Jeffrey Epstein as of January 2020.
Prosecutors reached out to attorney Gary Bloxsome to inquire whether he represents HRH The Duke of York (Prince Andrew) in connection with the Epstein investigation.
The email indicates that Prince Andrew is a person of interest or subject of inquiry in the federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's conduct.
